page.title: 02MONSAL TRAIL
page.content: {The Monsal Trail} is a pathway for walkers and cyclists on the trackbed of the former Midland Railway. The railway was opened in 1863 and was closed by British Rail in 1968. 12 years later is was handed over the the Peak District National Park for conversion to a Trail. The tunnels along the track were not thought to be safe so the trail bypasses these. The Trail leads from Bakewell to Chee Dale not far from Buxton. The Trail passes the former site of several stations and the remains of several lime kilns, at least one of these has been restored by the National Park. Much of the route passes through or close to sites of special scientific interest and nature reserves. A wide range of wild flowers are now colonising the former railway track bed.
